keyFindings: React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182) is being actively exploited by China-nexus APT groups Earth Lamia and Jackpot Panda
Multiple zero-day vulnerabilities affecting Microsoft, Apple, and cloud platforms require immediate patching
Ransomware gangs (Qilin, Akira, Cl0p, Rhysida) escalated operations in December 2025
Phishing-as-a-Service (PhaaS) kits enable sophisticated multi-channel attacks
Supply chain attacks via npm and SaaS integrations reached record levels
APT groups Prince of Persia (Iran) and Evasive Panda (China) launched new campaigns
immediateActions: Patch React2Shell vulnerability (CVE-2025-55182) in React 19.x and Next.js 15.x/16.x
Apply Microsoft December 2025 patches, especially CVE-2025-62221 and CVE-2025-54100
Update iOS devices to iOS 26 to address WebKit zero-days
Review npm dependencies for 'elf-' campaign and Shai-Hulud indicators
Audit SaaS OAuth integrations, particularly Salesforce/Drift connections

threatIntelligence.name: React2Shell - CVE-2025-55182
threatIntelligence.description: Pre-authentication remote code execution vulnerability in React Server Components Flight protocol allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code via unsafe deserialization of HTTP request payloads
affectedSystems: Next.js versions 15.x and 16.x using App Router
Node.js applications using React Server Components
Cloud-native applications on AWS, Azure, and GCP
threatIntelligence.exploitationSource: China-nexus APT groups Earth Lamia and Jackpot Panda

patchDetails.workaround: Block requests containing x-middleware-subrequest header externally

recommendedActions.description: Upgrade React to 19.2.1+ or Next.js to patched version
Implement WAF rules to block malicious header patterns
Search for lateral movement attempts via Azure IMDS, AWS metadata, GCP metadata

threatIntelligence.name: Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver EoP - CVE-2025-62221
threatIntelligence.description: Use-after-free vulnerability in Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver allowing local authenticated attackers to elevate privileges to SYSTEM

indicatorsOfCompromise.indicator: Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver events

threatIntelligence.name: PowerShell RCE - CVE-2025-54100
threatIntelligence.description: Remote code execution vulnerability in PowerShell allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code

recommendedActions.description: Review and restrict PowerShell execution policies

threatIntelligence.name: Apple WebKit Zero-Days - CVE-2025-43529, CVE-2025-14174
threatIntelligence.description: Two WebKit vulnerabilities exploited in targeted attacks - use-after-free and memory corruption allowing arbitrary code execution
affectedIndustries: All industries with mobile device deployments

threatIntelligence.name: Qilin Ransomware Campaign
threatIntelligence.description: Prolific ransomware-as-a-service group conducting multi-sector attacks with data theft and encryption, claiming 31,200TB of exfiltrated data

indicatorsOfCompromise.indicator: Double extortion - data theft before encryption

persistence: T1547 - Boot or Logon Autostart Execution

recommendedActions.description: Implement MFA for VPN/RDP, block excessive failed logins

threatIntelligence.name: Clop Ransomware - Oracle E-Business Suite Zero-Day
threatIntelligence.description: Clop gang exploiting Oracle E-Business Suite zero-day (CVE-2025-61882) for supply chain attacks affecting multiple organizations
attackVectors: Supply chain compromise via third-party vendors

recommendedActions.description: Review vendor access privileges and integrations

threatIntelligence.name: Akira Ransomware
threatIntelligence.description: Ransomware-as-a-Service group responsible for 34% of Q3 2025 attacks, targeting enterprise networks via VPN exploitation

recommendedActions.description: Monitor for SMB/RDP lateral movement patterns

threatIntelligence.name: ConsentFix Browser Attack
threatIntelligence.description: New browser-native attack combining OAuth consent phishing with ClickFix-style user prompts to steal credentials

recommendedActions.description: Educate on OAuth consent phishing indicators
Block mshta.exe and suspicious PowerShell patterns

threatIntelligence.name: Quishing (QR Code Phishing)
threatIntelligence.description: QR code phishing attacks embedding malicious codes in emails or physical locations to redirect victims to credential-stealing sites

recommendedActions.description: Block emails with QR code attachments
Train staff on QR code risks

threatIntelligence.name: Phishing-as-a-Service (PhaaS) Platforms
threatIntelligence.description: Criminal PhaaS kits (Tycoon, NakedPages, Sneaky2FA, Flowerstorm, Salty2FA, Evilginx) enabling sophisticated AITM attacks

indicatorsOfCompromise.indicator: Tycoon, NakedPages, Sneaky2FA, Flowerstorm, Salty2FA, Evilginx

recommendedActions.description: Monitor for concurrent sessions and anomalous behavior

threatIntelligence.name: Prince of Persia / Infy (Iran)
threatIntelligence.description: Iranian APT group resurfacing after years of dormancy with new malware using Telegram for C2 communication

threatIntelligence.name: Evasive Panda - MgBot Campaign
threatIntelligence.description: China-linked APT group conducting DNS poisoning campaign to deliver MgBot backdoor to victims in Turkey, China, and India

threatIntelligence.name: Blind Eagle (APT-C-36) - Colombia
threatIntelligence.description: South American APT targeting Colombian government entities using fileless attacks, compromised internal emails, and Caminho/DCRAT malware

threatIntelligence.name: Salesforce/Salesloft-Drift OAuth Attack
threatIntelligence.description: Largest SaaS supply chain breach in history - threat actors compromised OAuth tokens to access hundreds of downstream organizations
threatIntelligence.impact: Hundreds of organizations with compromised data access

threatIntelligence.name: npm 'elf-' Campaign
threatIntelligence.description: Malicious npm package wave with nearly 1,000 suspicious packages designed to steal sensitive system data and authentication credentials

recommendedActions.description: Scan for elf-* and Shai-Hulud packages

threatIntelligence.name: WIRED Data Leak
threatIntelligence.description: Data leak exposing 2.3 million WIRED subscribers on underground hacking forums, potentially linked to broader Cond√© Nast compromise

recommendedActions.description: Force password reset for WIRED-linked accounts

threatIntelligence.name: Korean Air Employee Data Breach
threatIntelligence.description: Clop-linked breach affecting 30,000 employee records via third-party vendor KC&D Service

recommendedActions.description: Audit vendor access to employee data

threatIntelligence.name: CVE-2025-66478
threatIntelligence.description: Critical software supply chain vulnerability added to CISA KEV requiring patching by December 24, 2025

workflows.description: Response workflow for Salesforce/Drift OAuth token compromise

Engage with vendor for root cause

immediate.action: Patch React2Shell vulnerability across all React Server Components deployments
Apply Microsoft December 2025 security updates, especially for CVE-2025-62221
Audit npm dependencies for 'elf-' campaign and Shai-Hulud indicators
immediate.affectedSystems: All development environments and CI/CD pipelines

shortTerm.action: Deploy phishing-resistant MFA (FIDO2/WebAuthn) across all users
Update iOS devices to iOS 26 to address WebKit zero-days
Review and audit all SaaS OAuth integrations

mediumTerm.action: Implement comprehensive EDR coverage with ransomware behavioral detection
Deploy WAF rules to protect against React2Shell exploitation
Enhance cloud security monitoring for metadata endpoint access

strategic.action: Establish automated threat intelligence integration with n8n workflows
Implement zero-trust architecture for critical systems
Conduct regular supply chain security assessments
